title: Helston Athletic F.C.
text:
Helston Athletic Football Club is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Helston">Helston</a>, <a href="Cornwall">Cornwall</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. They are currently members of the and play at Kellaway Park.
History.
The club was established in 1896. The joined the <a href="Cornwall%20Senior%20League">Cornwall Senior League</a> after its formation in 1931 and won back-to-back league titles in 1936–37 and 1937–38. After finishing as runners-up in 1938–39, they were champions for a third time in 1939–40. In 1953 the club joined the <a href="South%20Western%20Football%20League">South Western League</a>. They finished bottom of the South Western League in 1970–71, and after finishing second-from-bottom the following season, they left to join the <a href="Cornwall%20Combination">Cornwall Combination</a>.
Helston were Cornwall Combination champions in 1987–88 and again in 2000–01. After winning the league for a third time in 2010–11, the club were promoted to Division One West of the <a href="South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">South West Peninsula League</a>. They finished as runners-up in both of their first two seasons in the league, and after a third-place finish in <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2013–14</a>, the club won the division in <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2014–15</a>, earning promotion to the Premier Division. Following league reorganisation at the end of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2018–19 season</a>, the club were placed in the Premier Division West.
In 2021 Helston were promoted to the Premier Division of the <a href="Western%20Football%20League">Western League</a> based on their results in the abandoned <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2019–20</a> and <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2020–21</a> seasons.
Ground.
The club played at several grounds on Clodgey Lane before moving to Beacon Park in 1949, a ground which had been built by <a href="German%20prisoners%20of%20war%20in%20the%20United%20Kingdom">German POWs</a> shortly after <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>. In 1972 they moved to their current ground, Kellaway Park, also on the same road. The ground initially consisted of a rented pitch, before a wooden shed was built that also served as the clubhouse. A new clubhouse was built in 1988 and included a roof overhang for spectator cover.
In 2015 a 100-seat stand and floodlights were installed, with the first match under lights played on 1 September 2015 against <a href="A.F.C.%20St%20Austell">St Austell</a>.
